page.title: 02A DAY IN MY LIFE
page.content: My name is Sarah Jane Stewart and I am nine years old. On a Thursday morning I get up at 7.30 a.m., dress in my Brownie uniform and go through for my breakfast which consists of cereal, tea, toast and fruit juice. Then I wash and brush my teeth. Having collected my swimming gear, I go out to wait for the School Bus which arrives at 8.30 a.m. School begins at 9.00 a.m. and on Thursday instead of Maths and English, as soon as the register has been taken we board the bus for Helensburgh where the pool is. This is 16 miles away. We return to school at 11.30 (if the bus does not break down). School lunches are served at 12 o'clock, but I normally take a packed lunch. In the afternoon we work on various projects and after 3.00 p.m. the boys play football. Straight after school, at 3.30 p.m., I
